## Deconstructor.\_fromBuffer() method

The function that actually reads the buffer and returns deconstructed value

You shouldn't call this function explicitly. However, if you're \_implementing\_ a new Deconstructor, this is where you do it.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
_fromBuffer(buffer: OutputBuffer, offset: number): Deconstruction<T>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  buffer | <code>OutputBuffer</code> |  |
|  offset | <code>number</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`Deconstruction<T>`
